conclusion: The problem involves an electron moving in a uniform electric field between two parallel plates. conclusion: The velocity change due to the electric field is along the perpendicular direction to \( v_0 \).

conclusion: The perpendicular component of the final velocity is \( v_0 \sin(30^\circ) \).

premise: The perpendicular component of the final velocity is \( v_0 \sin(30^\circ) \), and \( v_0 = 4 \times 10^6 \, \mathrm{m/s} \).
conclusion: The perpendicular component of the final velocity is \( 2 \times 10^6 \, \mathrm{m/s} \).

premise: The formula for kinetic energy is \( KE = \frac{1}{2} m v^2 \), where \( m \) is the mass of the electron and \( v \) is its velocity.

conclusion: The magnitude of the final velocity is \( \sqrt{16 \times 10^{12} + 4 \times 10^{12}} = \sqrt{20 \times 10^{12}} \).

conclusion: The magnitude of the final velocity is \( \sqrt{2} \times 10^6 \, \mathrm{m/s} \).
